messageBody:
--- Soaring Eagle <comfortable.numb@...> wrote:

> Hello Folks,
>
> I am trying to unit test my code that is to be
> deployed in a Weblogic
> container. I have been able to seperate most
> functional code from the
> EJB code and am able to unit test most of the code.
> However, some of
> my tests still throw errors simply because i am
> running these tests
> outside of the weblogic's JVM. Is there a way to get
> into a running
> JVM (weblogic in my case) and load junit classes and
> my classes in
> that container's JVM?

I think this might be what you're looking for:
http://www.junitee.org/

I just started looking at it myself and got distracted
with other things, so I can't claim to have experience
using it. Looks like it is pretty useful for this
kind of thing though.
